A Frenchman has just set a
Guinness record for the world's tallest FM tower model
made of matchsticks. However,
the journey to set this record was not
easy. 48-year-old Richard L spent more than 4,200 years.
hours over the past 8 years to make the
7.9 m high fen symbolic tower. In total,
Richard used more than 76,000 matches and 23
kg of glue. The final puzzle piece was
completed on December 27
last year on the occasion of the anniversary.  100 years since the death
of the tower's designer, architect
gustav fen, Guinness World Records
once disqualified Rard's records because he
used custom-made wooden matches that did not
have a spatula at the end of each stick like other
types.  Matches are sold on the market. However,
after much consideration, they decided
to give him the record. My emotions were like a
train. So at first I was disappointed. But
now it's great. I've fulfilled
my dream, according to the representative.  According to
Guinness, Richard's record
is also a record of perseverance and determination.
He broke the previous LC record set in
2009 for the next 6.53 m tall f tower model
